appendix.title: Tapestry JAR files
appendix.para: The Tapestry distribution includes a number of JAR files, some of which are needed to compile the framework (and examples), others are used at runtime (and must be added to the servlet container's classpath).

listitem.para: Contains the EJB 1.1 packages. These classes are needed by Tapestry at runtime (Tapestry includes some special handling of EJB client stubs recorded by a &PageRecorder;. However, most often, the servlet container or application server provides these interfaces and classes.
Regular expression library, used to validate specification ids. Needed by Tapestry at runtime.
Defines the Java Servlet API. Again, these classes and interfaces are needed by Tapestry at runtime, but are almost always provided by the servlet container.
The Java API for XML Processing. Needed at runtime to allow Tapestry to locate an XML processor, used to parse application and component specifications.
The JFreeChart libraries, which are used in the Tapestry Workbench tutorial to generate a dynamic pie chart.
The JUnit testing framework, used by the Tapestry unit tests (in the junit directory).
The &Log4J; logging framework. This is used by Tapestry at runtime.
The McKoi SQL Database, a GPL Java database. This is used by the Virtual Library demonstration.
The Object Graph Navigation Library, which provides dynamic evaluation of JavaBeans property expressions. This is used by Tapestry at runtime.

The main Tapestry framework. This is needed at compile time and runtime. At runtime, it is most often added to the servlet container's classpath. The framework release number is integrated into the file name.

Contains additional components and tools that are not integral to the framework itself, such as the Palette. Needed at runtime if any such components are used in an application. The framework release number is integrated into the file name.
An XML parser that can be used by Tapestry unless a different one is configured.
The &Jetty; servlet container, used to execute the Tapestry examples, tutorials and demostrations.
Example Tapestry applications. Vlib.war is incorporated into Vlib.ear.
An EJB JAR, containing entity and session EJBs for deployment with &JBoss;. VlibBeans.jar is incorporated into Vlib.ear.
